intro: Obione pamirica, commonly known as the Pamir orchid, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Pamir Mountains. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers display a range of colors, including white, yellow, and purple. Due to its limited habitat and environmental sensitivity, Obione pamirica is considered a vulnerable species.
